title: DeepLabCut Issue Where Deleting Frames During Labeling Causes Training Dataset to Not Form; Program Looks for Deleted Data

labels.name: howtousedlc
labels.description: issue regarding the use of DeepLabCut

body:
Thanks for opening this issue, and thanks for using DeepLabCut (we hope you are enjoying it ;). Please fill out the template completely, including the full "traceback" and input code that you ran to hit this error. **Your Operating system and DeepLabCut version** Please state your operating system, env, and which version of DeepLabCut you are using. Example: Windows 10 with an Anaconda Env, & DeepLabCut 2.2 Please complete the following information about your system: OS: Windows 10 DeepLabCut Version: 2.2 Anaconda env used: DLC-GPU **Describe the problem** I deleted frames when labeling my data. Now when I go to make a training set with this data I get repeated errors that DeepLabCut cannot find the files I deleted. I checked the CSVs made when labeling is completed and I see blanks where the deleted files should be, so I don't know what triggers this error. I use the GUI version for reference as well. Please place code inside this:
C:\Users\rosen\Desktop\Rosen_DeepLabCut\Melano_DLC_Rosen-Melano_DLC_Rosen-2021-03-03\training-datasets\iteration-0\UnaugmentedDataSet_Melano_DLC_RosenMar3 already exists! Traceback (most recent call last): File "C:\Users\rosen\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\gui\create_training_dataset.py", line 385, in create_training_dataset augmenter_type=self.aug_choice.GetValue(), File "C:\Users\rosen\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\generate_training_dataset\trainingsetmanipulation.py", line 1020, in create_training_dataset Data, trainIndices, nbodyparts, project_path File "C:\Users\rosen\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\generate_training_dataset\trainingsetmanipulation.py", line 793, in format_training_data img_shape = _read_image_shape_fast(os.path.join(project_path, filename)) File "C:\Users\rosen\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\generate_training_dataset\trainingsetmanipulation.py", line 777, in _read_image_shape_fast return io.imread(path).shape File "C:\Users\rosen\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\skimage\io\_io.py", line 48, in imread img = call_plugin('imread', fname, plugin=plugin, **plugin_args) File "C:\Users\rosen\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\skimage\io\manage_plugins.py", line 209, in call_plugin return func(*args, **kwargs) File "C:\Users\rosen\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\skimage\io\_plugins\imageio_plugin.py", line 10, in imread return np.asarray(imageio_imread(*args, **kwargs)) File "C:\Users\rosen\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\imageio\core\functions.py", line 265, in imread reader = read(uri, format, "i", **kwargs) File "C:\Users\rosen\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\imageio\core\functions.py", line 172, in get_reader request = Request(uri, "r" + mode, **kwargs) File "C:\Users\rosen\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\imageio\core\request.py", line 124, in __init__ self._parse_uri(uri) File "C:\Users\rosen\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\imageio\core\request.py", line 260, in _parse_uri raise FileNotFoundError("No such file: '%s'" % fn) FileNotFoundError: No such file: 'C:\Users\rosen\Desktop\Rosen_DeepLabCut\Melano_DLC_Rosen-Melano_DLC_Rosen-2021-03-03\labeled-data\022221_Melano_Video001_SOFT\img8101.png'

[Please copy/paste the full terminal output of the error here!!!]

**How to Reproduce the problem** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Open DeepLabCut and go to 'Label Frames' 2. Label data and use the delete frames button to remove bad frames from your data set 3. Finish labeling, hit save and exit out of the labeling menu 4. Click 'Create training dataset' and click OK, and see the error magically appear right on your very own screen
